name: Vilkas

aspects.high_concept: Sharpest Mind and Bitterest Blade in Jorrvaskr
aspects.trouble: The Wolf's Anger Is My Own
other_aspects: Harder on Himself Than Anyone Else

stunts: Tactical Eye: +2 to Notice when assessing enemy formations or combat terrain.
Scholar-Warrior: Once per session, Vilkas may use Lore in place of Fight for a single overcome action when recalling a historical combat technique.
Pack Ferocity: When fighting alongside another Companion NPC, both gain +1 to their next Fight roll.
notes: Vilkas is the intellectual conscience of the Companions - bookish for a warrior, sharp-tongued, and deeply loyal beneath his prickly surface. He resents the beast blood philosophically (agreeing with Kodlak) but struggles to contain the wolf's rage that makes him short-tempered. He tests new Companions hard because he believes the guild deserves only the best.

trust_clock.description: Vilkas's respect is earned through demonstrated skill, discipline, and intellectual engagement.
gain_triggers: +1: winning a trial with tactical superiority, not just brute force
+1: showing knowledge of Companions history or Nordic tradition
+2: helping Kodlak pursue the cure (Vilkas shares the dream)
+1: accepting Vilkas's criticism without argument and improving
loss_triggers: -1: sloppy or reckless combat that embarrasses the guild
-2: dismissing the importance of Companions history
-1: challenging Vilkas's authority in front of newer members

milestones.2: Vilkas stops testing and starts advising
milestones.4: Vilkas shares his own conflict with the beast blood
milestones.6: Vilkas names PC as his Shield-Sibling - the highest personal compliment he gives

combat_tactics: Vilkas fights with controlled aggression - he reads openings and waits for the perfect moment. His intelligence makes him unpredictable; enemies expecting a berserk Nord get a calculated swordsman. When his wolf-rage slips through, his attacks become more powerful but less precise.

relationships.Kodlak Whitemane: Deep reverence; Kodlak is father-figure and moral compass
relationships.Farkas: Twin brother; protective, occasionally exasperated by Farkas's simplicity
relationships.Skjor: Mutual respect, ideological friction over beast blood
relationships.Aela the Huntress: Tense camaraderie; she embraces what he resents
relationships.The Player: Judges harshly at first; trust is earned not given

dialogue_samples.greeting: You're the one asking to join? Show me your sword arm first. Words are cheap in Jorrvaskr.
dialogue_samples.testing: The shield-siblings will tell you I'm hard on new blood. They're right. Kodlak deserves better than mediocrity.
dialogue_samples.on_beast_blood: Power at the cost of your soul is no bargain I'd take willingly. Kodlak is right to seek a cure. I just... struggle to refuse the wolf when it howls.
dialogue_samples.after_proving_honor: You passed. Don't let it go to your head - passing the entry trial just means you're not useless yet.
